context: In July 2002, Beyoncé continued her acting career playing <a11_0>Foxxy Cleopatra<a11_0/> alongside <a0_0>Mike Myers<a0_0/> in the comedy film, <a5_0><a10_0>Austin Powers in Goldmember<a10_0/><a5_0/>, which spent its first weekend atop the US box office and grossed $<a6_0>73 million<a6_0/>. Beyoncé released "<a12_0>Work It Out<a12_0/>" as the lead single from its soundtrack album which entered the top ten in the <a1_0>UK, Norway, and Belgium<a1_0/>. In 2003, Beyoncé starred opposite Cuba Gooding, Jr., in the <a7_0>musical comedy<a7_0/> <a2_0><a13_0>The <a8_0><a14_0>Fighting Temptations<a14_0/><a13_0/><a8_0/><a2_0/> as Lilly, a single mother whom Gooding's character falls in love with. The film received <a9_0>mixed reviews<a9_0/> from critics but grossed $30 million in the U.S. Beyoncé released "Fighting Temptation" as the lead single from the film's soundtrack album, with <a3_0>Missy Elliott<a3_0/>, MC Lyte, and Free which was also used to promote the film. Another of Beyoncé's contributions to the soundtrack, "<a4_0>Summertime<a4_0/>", fared better on the US charts.
